awd_abstract_narration: While the role of randomization in algorithms design has not                    been fully understood, several important computational                          problems have been solved elegantly using randomization.  The                   best known randomized algorithms for a variety of problems                      have better resource bounds than their deterministic                            counterparts.  The research addresses the issue of a better                     understanding of randomization, by studying its function in                     the design of parallel algorithms for three critical computing                  problems, 1) Sorting and Selection, 2) Packet Routing, and 3)                   Combinatorial Optimization.  Optimal or near optimal parallel                   algorithms for these three problems on various models of                        parallel computing will be designed.  Sampling and algorithmic                  tools developed in this project will find applications in such                  diverse areas as natural language processing, computer                          simulation, motion planning, etc.//
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
